title: ICYMI: A ‘singing’ lake and a lava fountain
description: From some chilled out phenomena to feeling the heat in our weekly video round up: In Case You Missed It.

title: WW2's 'Spitfire Women': Eleanor Wadsworth, one of last female pilots, dies
description: Eleanor Wadsworth flew hundreds of aircraft, including Spitfires and Hurricanes, to the front line in WW2.

title: Covid-19: 'Eye of the storm' lockdown warning as cases rise
description: Prof Peter Horby, who chairs the Nervtag advisory group, said the situation was "much worse" than in March.

title: Pakistan power cut plunges country into darkness
description: Electricity is gradually being restored after a huge outage triggered by a power station fault.

title: Woman arrested after two men die at house in east London
description: The woman, who was Tasered by officers, is taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

title: Covid-19: Drop 'absurd' 5% council tax increase - Starmer
description: The Labour leader urges ministers to give councils more money instead to protect family budgets.

title: Indonesia Sriwijaya Air Boeing 737 black boxes located
description: Signals are detected which officials think show the location of the Boeing 737's flight recorders.

title: Covid-19: Rapid tests for asymptomatic people to be rolled out
description: People who cannot work from home should be prioritised for rapid tests in England, the government says.

title: FA Cup third round: BBC to stream Chelsea and Man City games
description: Chelsea's FA Cup third-round tie with Morecambe and Manchester City's home match with Birmingham City are among eight to be streamed on the BBC.

title: Australia close in on third Test win over India
description: India face a daunting task to avoid defeat in the third Test against Australia after closing day four on 98-2, requiring a further 309 runs to win.

title: John Lister: 'Lonely' Norfolk man sent 15,000 cards and gifts dies
description: John Lister's care home say the cards helped him get through his first Christmas without his wife.

title: Covid-19: Priti Patel defends police lockdown fines
description: Officers "will not hesitate" to take action against those breaking the rules, home secretary says.

title: 'QAnon Shaman' Jake Angeli charged over pro-Trump riots
description: Jake Angeli, real name Jacob Anthony Chansley, is accused of violent entry and disorderly conduct.

title: Covid-19: Nurse isolating in caravan for nine months moves back home
description: Sarah Link lived in a caravan on her own drive so she could carry on working and protect her mother.

title: Parler: Amazon to remove site from web hosting service
description: If Parler fails to find a new web hosting service by Sunday, the entire network will go offline.

title: Lost dogs: The team reuniting pooches with their owners
description: These pet detectives have saved hundreds of missing and stolen dogs during the pandemic alone.

title: Coronavirus: Virtual Mass tour across Ireland for 107-year-old
description: A 107-year-old woman from County Meath is attempting to attend a virtual Mass in every county.

title: Buccaneers, Bills & Rams advance in NFL play-offs
description: Tom Brady and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers hold off a spirited display by Washington to advance to the Divisional Round of the NFL play-offs.

title: The papers: Hospital 'crisis' and police 'get tough' on fines
description: Sunday's papers carry renewed calls for the public to follow lockdown rules as UK deaths pass 80,000.

title: Uganda elections 2021: How ex-rebel Yoweri Museveni has stayed in power for 35 years
description: Uganda's Yoweri Museveni is running for a sixth elected term in office, against 10 challengers.

title: Singapore: Why these defiant 'nail house' owners refuse to sell
description: A block of luxury flats in Singapore is being built around two homes whose owners refuse to move.

title: Can onboard rollercoasters save the cruise industry?
description: The Mardi Gras is going overboard with new features to lure back passengers, including a micro-brewery.

title: Albania races to rescue children from jihadist camp
description: Why Albania wants to repatriate dozens of youngsters from al-Hol in northern Syria.

title: Viewpoint: What the Capitol riot means for US foreign policy
description: President-elect Joe Biden needs to unite his nation to fix US policy abroad, Jonathan Marcus writes.

title: Coronavirus: Virus provides leaps in scientific understanding
description: How a year of intense scientific effort unravelled the secrets of a virus that shut down the world.

title: How South African police are tackling pangolin smugglers
description: The pangolin is said to be the world's most trafficked mammal. The BBC reports on a rescue operation.

title: When driving a tuk-tuk pays more than making art
description: Papier mache artisans in Kashmir are giving up the dying craft for more lucrative jobs.

title: The secret artists creating miniature buildings for street mice
description: From record stores to pharmacies, secret artist group AnonyMouse have been creating little places for mice.

title: The 65 days that led to chaos at the Capitol
description: The riots of 6 January took many by surprise, but to those tracking conspiracy and extreme right groups online, the warning signs were all there.
